title.raw: 《商君列傳》 Biography of Lord Shang

sentences.zh: 商君者，衛之諸庶孽公子也，名鞅，姓公孫氏，其祖本姬姓也。

translations.literal: Lord Shang was an illegitimate son of a minor branch of the Wei nobility. His name was Yang, his surname Gongsun, and his ancestors originally bore the Ji surname.

sentences.zh: 鞅少好刑名之學，事魏相公叔座為中庶子。

translations.literal: From a young age, Yang was fascinated by the study of law and political philosophy. He served as a junior aide to Gongshu Zuo, the chancellor of Wei.

sentences.zh: 公叔座知其賢，未及進。

translations.literal: Gongshu Zuo recognized Yang's exceptional abilities but had not yet promoted him.

sentences.zh: 會座病，魏惠王親往問病，曰：「公叔病有如不可諱，將柰社稷何？」

translations.literal: Just then Zuo fell ill, King Hui of Wei personally went to inquire after his illness, said: 'If chancellor should die, what shall we do for the state?'
translations.idiomatic: Just then Gongshu fell ill. King Hui of Wei went in person to inquire after his health and asked, "If the chancellor should pass away, what will become of the state?"

sentences.zh: 公叔曰：「座之中庶子公孫鞅，年雖少，有奇才，願王舉國而聽之。」

translations.literal: Gongshu said: 'My junior aide Gongsun Yang, though young, has extraordinary talent, I wish Your Majesty would entrust the entire state to him.'
translations.idiomatic: Gongshu replied, "My junior aide, Gongsun Yang, is young but possesses extraordinary talent. I urge Your Majesty to entrust the entire state to his care."

sentences.zh: 王嘿然。

translations.literal: The king fell silent.

sentences.zh: 王且去，座屏人言曰：「王即不聽用鞅，必殺之，無令出境。」

translations.literal: The king was about to leave when Zuo dismissed his attendants and said: 'If Your Majesty does not employ Yang, you must kill him, do not let him leave the borders.'
translations.idiomatic: As the king was about to depart, Gongshu dismissed his attendants and said in private, "If Your Majesty will not employ Yang, then you must kill him. Do not allow him to leave our borders."

sentences.zh: 王許諾而去。

translations.literal: The king agreed and left.

sentences.zh: 公叔座召鞅謝曰：「今者王問可以為相者，我言若，王色不許我。

translations.literal: Gongshu Zuo summoned Yang and apologized: 'Just now when the king asked who could be chancellor, I recommended you, but the king's expression did not approve.
translations.idiomatic: Gongshu Zuo summoned Yang and apologized, saying, "Just now when the king asked who could serve as chancellor, I recommended you. But his expression showed he did not approve.

sentences.zh: 我方先君後臣，因謂王即弗用鞅，當殺之。

translations.literal: I put loyalty to the ruler above ministerial friendship, so I told the king that if he would not employ you, he should have you killed.

sentences.zh: 王許我。

translations.literal: The king agreed.

sentences.zh: 汝可疾去矣，且見禽。」

translations.literal: You should leave quickly, you will soon be captured.'
translations.idiomatic: You should leave at once—you will soon be arrested."

sentences.zh: 鞅曰：「彼王不能用君之言任臣，又安能用君之言殺臣乎？」

translations.literal: Yang said: 'If he cannot employ you by following your recommendation to use me, how can he employ you by following your recommendation to kill me?'
translations.idiomatic: Yang replied, "If the king cannot follow your advice to employ me, how can he follow your advice to kill me?"

sentences.zh: 卒不去。

translations.literal: In the end, Yang did not leave.

sentences.zh: 惠王既去，而謂左右曰：「公叔病甚，悲乎，欲令寡人以國聽公孫鞅也，豈不悖哉！」

translations.literal: King Hui having departed, he told his attendants: 'Gongshu is gravely ill, how lamentable, he wants me to entrust the state to Gongsun Yang, is this not absurd!'
translations.idiomatic: After King Hui left, he remarked to his attendants, "Gongshu is gravely ill—how unfortunate! He wants me to entrust the entire state to Gongsun Yang. Is this not madness?"

translations.literal: Lord Shang was a bastard son of a branch of the Wei nobility, named Yang, surnamed Gongsun, his ancestry originally of the Ji surname. Yang in youth delighted in the study of law and names, served as junior aide to Wei chancellor Gongshu Zuo. Gongshu Zuo knew his worth, but had not yet advanced him. Just then Zuo fell ill, King Hui of Wei personally went to inquire after his illness, said: 'If chancellor should die, what shall we do for the state?' Gongshu said: 'My junior aide Gongsun Yang, though young, has extraordinary talent, I wish Your Majesty would entrust the entire state to him.' The king was silent. The king was about to leave when Zuo dismissed his attendants and said: 'If Your Majesty does not employ Yang, you must kill him, do not let him leave the borders.' The king agreed and departed. Gongshu Zuo summoned Yang and apologized: 'Just now when the king asked who could be chancellor, I recommended you, but the king's expression did not approve. I am putting the ruler first and ministers second, so I told the king that if he does not employ Yang, he should kill him. The king agreed to me. You should leave quickly, you will soon be captured.' Yang said: 'If he cannot employ you by following your recommendation to use me, how can he employ you by following your recommendation to kill me?' He finally did not leave. King Hui having departed, he told his attendants: 'Gongshu is gravely ill, how lamentable, he wants me to entrust the state to Gongsun Yang, is this not absurd!'

sentences.zh: 公叔既死，公孫鞅聞秦孝公下令國中求賢者，將修繆公之業，東復侵地，乃遂西入秦，因孝公寵臣景監以求見孝公。

translations.literal: Gongshu having died, Gongsun Yang heard that Duke Xiao of Qin had issued an edict throughout the state seeking worthy men, intending to revive Duke Mu's achievements and eastward recover lost territories, so he went west to Qin, through Duke Xiao's favored minister Jing Jian to seek audience with Duke Xiao.
translations.idiomatic: After Gongshu's death, Gongsun Yang learned that Duke Xiao of Qin had issued an edict throughout his realm seeking talented men. The duke intended to revive Duke Mu's legacy and recover territories lost to the east. Yang traveled west to Qin and, through the duke's favored minister Jing Jian, sought an audience with Duke Xiao.

sentences.zh: 孝公既見衛鞅，語事良久，孝公時時睡，弗聽。

translations.literal: Duke Xiao granted Wei Yang an audience. They spoke of state affairs for a long time, but the duke kept dozing off and paid no attention.

sentences.zh: 罷而孝公怒景監曰：「子之客妄人耳，安足用邪！」

translations.literal: Retiring, Duke Xiao angrily rebuked Jing Jian: 'Your guest is a charlatan, how can he be employed!'
translations.idiomatic: After the audience ended, Duke Xiao angrily rebuked Jing Jian, saying, "Your guest is nothing but a charlatan! How could he possibly be of use?"

sentences.zh: 景監以讓衛鞅。

translations.literal: Jing Jian conveyed this criticism to Wei Yang.

sentences.zh: 衛鞅曰：「吾說公以帝道，其志不開悟矣。」

translations.literal: Wei Yang said: 'I advised him with the way of the emperor, his will is not enlightened.'
translations.idiomatic: Wei Yang replied, "I counseled him with the imperial way, but his mind remains unenlightened."

sentences.zh: 後五日，復求見鞅。

translations.literal: Five days later, Yang again requested an audience.

sentences.zh: 鞅復見孝公，益愈，然而未中旨。

translations.literal: Yang met with Duke Xiao again and spoke even more eloquently, but still failed to win his approval.

sentences.zh: 罷而孝公復讓景監，景監亦讓鞅。

translations.literal: After the audience, Duke Xiao again scolded Jing Jian, who in turn scolded Yang.

sentences.zh: 鞅曰：「吾說公以王道而未入也。

translations.literal: Yang said: 'I advised him with the way of the king but it did not enter.
translations.idiomatic: Yang said, "I counseled him with the royal way, but it did not resonate.

sentences.zh: 請復見鞅。」

translations.literal: Please let me see him again.'
translations.idiomatic: Please allow me to see him once more."

sentences.zh: 鞅復見孝公，孝公善之而未用也。

translations.literal: Yang met with Duke Xiao once more. The duke was pleased but still did not offer him a position.

sentences.zh: 罷而去。

translations.literal: The audience ended and Yang departed.

sentences.zh: 孝公謂景監曰：「汝客善，可與語矣。」

translations.literal: Duke Xiao told Jing Jian: 'Your guest is good, one can converse with him.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiao told Jing Jian, "Your guest is impressive—one can actually hold a conversation with him."

sentences.zh: 鞅曰：「吾說公以霸道，其意欲用之矣。

translations.literal: Yang said: 'I advised him with the way of hegemony, his intention desires to employ it.
translations.idiomatic: Yang said, "I counseled him with the way of hegemony. His intentions now favor employing me.

sentences.zh: 誠復見我，我知之矣。」

translations.literal: If he truly sees me again, I will know it.'
translations.idiomatic: If he truly invites me back, I will know for certain."

sentences.zh: 衛鞅復見孝公。

translations.literal: Wei Yang met with Duke Xiao once more.

sentences.zh: 公與語，不自知厀之前於席也。

translations.literal: As they conversed, the duke unconsciously leaned forward on his mat.

sentences.zh: 語數日不厭。

translations.literal: They spoke for several days without growing weary.

sentences.zh: 景監曰：「子何以中吾君？

translations.literal: Jing Jian said: 'How did you hit upon our lord's pleasure?
translations.idiomatic: Jing Jian asked, "How did you manage to please our lord?

sentences.zh: 吾君之驩甚也。」

translations.literal: Our lord's delight is extreme.'
translations.idiomatic: Our lord's delight is quite extraordinary."

sentences.zh: 鞅曰：「吾說君以帝王之道比三代，而君曰：『久遠，吾不能待。

translations.literal: Yang said: 'I advised the lord with the ways of emperors and kings compared to the Three Dynasties, but the lord said: "Too distant, I cannot wait.
translations.idiomatic: Yang replied, "I first counseled the lord with the ways of emperors and kings, comparing them to the Three Dynasties. But the lord said, 'Too distant—I cannot wait.

sentences.zh: 且賢君者，各及其身顯名天下，安能邑邑待數十百年以成帝王乎？』

translations.literal: Moreover worthy rulers each in their own time make their name illustrious throughout the world, how can they gloomily wait decades or centuries to become emperors and kings?"'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, worthy rulers make their names illustrious throughout the world in their own lifetimes. How can they gloomily wait decades or centuries to achieve imperial greatness?'

sentences.zh: 故吾以彊國之術說君，君大說之耳。

translations.literal: Therefore, I counseled him with methods to strengthen the state, and the lord was greatly pleased.

sentences.zh: 然亦難以比德於殷周矣。」

translations.literal: However it is also difficult to compare in virtue to Yin and Zhou.'
translations.idiomatic: However, it is difficult to compare his virtue with that of the Yin and Zhou dynasties."

translations.literal: Gongshu having died, Gongsun Yang heard that Duke Xiao of Qin had issued an edict throughout the state seeking worthy men, intending to revive Duke Mu's achievements and eastward recover lost territories, so he went west to Qin, through Duke Xiao's favored minister Jing Jian to seek audience with Duke Xiao. Duke Xiao having seen Wei Yang, spoke of affairs for a long time, Duke Xiao frequently dozed off, did not listen. Retiring, Duke Xiao angrily rebuked Jing Jian: 'Your guest is a charlatan, how can he be employed!' Jing Jian relayed this to Wei Yang. Wei Yang said: 'I advised him with the way of the emperor, his will is not enlightened.' After five days, he again sought to see Yang. Yang again saw Duke Xiao, spoke even better, but still not to his liking. Retiring, Duke Xiao again rebuked Jing Jian, Jing Jian also rebuked Yang. Yang said: 'I advised him with the way of the king but it did not enter. Please let me see him again.' Yang again saw Duke Xiao, Duke Xiao approved but did not yet employ him. Retiring and leaving. Duke Xiao told Jing Jian: 'Your guest is good, one can converse with him.' Yang said: 'I advised him with the way of hegemony, his intention desires to employ it. If he truly sees me again, I will know it.' Wei Yang again saw Duke Xiao. The duke conversed with him, unconsciously slid forward on the mat. Spoke for several days without tiring. Jing Jian said: 'How did you hit upon our lord's pleasure? Our lord's delight is extreme.' Yang said: 'I advised the lord with the ways of emperors and kings compared to the Three Dynasties, but the lord said: "Too distant, I cannot wait. Moreover worthy rulers each in their own time make their name illustrious throughout the world, how can they gloomily wait decades or centuries to become emperors and kings?"' Therefore I advised him with methods to strengthen the state, the lord greatly delighted in them. However it is also difficult to compare in virtue to Yin and Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 孝公既用衛鞅，鞅欲變法，恐天下議己。

translations.literal: Duke Xiao employed Wei Yang, who wished to reform the laws. But Yang feared that the world would criticize him.

sentences.zh: 衛鞅曰：「疑行無名，疑事無功。

translations.literal: Wei Yang said: 'Doubtful actions have no reputation, doubtful affairs have no merit.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Yang replied, "Doubtful actions bring no reputation; doubtful affairs achieve no merit.

sentences.zh: 且夫有高人之行者，固見非於世；

translations.literal: Moreover those who practice superior conduct are surely criticized by the age;
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, those who practice superior conduct are inevitably criticized by their age;

sentences.zh: 有獨知之慮者，必見敖於民。

translations.literal: those with unique wisdom are inevitably scorned by the people.

sentences.zh: 愚者闇於成事，知者見於未萌。

translations.literal: Fools are blind to accomplished facts; wise men see things at their inception.

sentences.zh: 民不可與慮始而可與樂成。

translations.literal: The people cannot be consulted about beginnings, but they can enjoy successes.

sentences.zh: 論至德者不和於俗，成大功者不謀於眾。

translations.literal: Those who discuss supreme virtue do not harmonize with custom; those who accomplish great merit do not consult the multitude.

sentences.zh: 是以聖人茍可以彊國，不法其故；

translations.literal: Therefore sages if they can strengthen the state, do not follow old laws;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, if sages can strengthen the state, they do not follow old laws;

sentences.zh: 茍可以利民，不循其禮。」

translations.literal: If they can benefit the people, do not follow old rituals.'
translations.idiomatic: if they can benefit the people, they do not follow old rituals."

sentences.zh: 孝公曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Duke Xiao said: "Good."
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiao replied, "Excellent."

sentences.zh: 甘龍曰：「不然。

translations.literal: Gan Long said: "Not so.
translations.idiomatic: Gan Long objected, "Not so.

sentences.zh: 聖人不易民而教，知者不變法而治。

translations.literal: Sages do not change the people and teach, wise men do not alter laws and govern.

sentences.zh: 因民而教，不勞而成功；

translations.literal: Following the people and teaching, without labor succeeds;

sentences.zh: 緣法而治者，吏習而民安之。」

translations.literal: Following laws and governing, officials are familiar and people at peace with them."

sentences.zh: 衛鞅曰：「龍之所言，世俗之言也。

translations.literal: Wei Yang said: "What Long says is the talk of common customs.

sentences.zh: 常人安於故俗，學者溺於所聞。

translations.literal: Ordinary people are at peace with old customs, scholars drown in what they have heard.

sentences.zh: 以此兩者居官守法可也，非所與論於法之外也。

translations.literal: With these two occupying office and keeping laws is acceptable, but not for discussing beyond the laws.

sentences.zh: 三代不同禮而王，五伯不同法而霸。

translations.literal: The Three Dynasties differed in ritual yet became kings, the Five Hegemons differed in law yet became hegemons.

sentences.zh: 智者作法，愚者制焉；

translations.literal: Wise men create laws, fools are restricted by them;

sentences.zh: 賢者更禮，不肖者拘焉。」

translations.literal: Worthy men change rituals, worthless men are bound by them."

sentences.zh: 杜摯曰：「利不百，不變法；

translations.literal: Du Zhi said: "Benefit not a hundredfold, do not change law;

sentences.zh: 功不十，不易器。

translations.literal: Merit not tenfold, do not change implements.

sentences.zh: 法古無過，循禮無邪。」

translations.literal: Following antiquity has no fault, following ritual has no error."

sentences.zh: 衛鞅曰：「治世不一道，便國不法古。

translations.literal: Wei Yang said: "Governing the age is not one way, benefiting the state does not follow antiquity.

sentences.zh: 故湯武不循古而王，夏殷不易禮而亡。

translations.literal: Therefore Tang and Wu did not follow antiquity and became kings, Xia and Yin did not change ritual and perished.

sentences.zh: 反古者不可非，而循禮者不足多。」

translations.literal: Those who oppose antiquity cannot be criticized, those who follow ritual are not worth praising."

sentences.zh: 孝公曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Duke Xiao said: "Good."

sentences.zh: 以衛鞅為左庶長，卒定變法之令。

translations.literal: Employed Wei Yang as Left Senior Chamberlain, finally established the change law edict.

Duke Xiao having employed Wei Yang, Yang wished to change the laws, feared the world would criticize him. Wei Yang said: 'Doubtful actions have no reputation, doubtful affairs have no merit. Moreover those who practice superior conduct are surely criticized by the age; Those with unique wisdom are surely scorned by the people. Fools are dark about completed affairs, wise men see things at their inception. The people cannot be consulted about beginnings but can enjoy successes. Those who discuss supreme virtue do not harmonize with custom, those who accomplish great merit do not consult the multitude. Therefore sages if they can strengthen the state, do not follow old laws; If they can benefit the people, do not follow old rituals.' Duke Xiao said: "Good." Gan Long said: "Not so. Sages do not change the people and teach, wise men do not alter laws and govern. Following the people and teaching, without labor succeeds; Following laws and governing, officials are familiar and people at peace with them." Wei Yang said: "What Long says is the talk of common customs. Ordinary people are at peace with old customs, scholars drown in what they have heard. With these two occupying office and keeping laws is acceptable, but not for discussing beyond the laws. The Three Dynasties differed in ritual yet became kings, the Five Hegemons differed in law yet became hegemons. Wise men create laws, fools are restricted by them; Worthy men change rituals, worthless men are bound by them." Du Zhi said: "Benefit not a hundredfold, do not change law; Merit not tenfold, do not change implements. Following antiquity has no fault, following ritual has no error." Wei Yang said: "Governing the age is not one way, benefiting the state does not follow antiquity. Therefore Tang and Wu did not follow antiquity and became kings, Xia and Yin did not change ritual and perished. Those who oppose antiquity cannot be criticized, those who follow ritual are not worth praising." Duke Xiao said: "Good." Employed Wei Yang as Left Senior Chamberlain, finally established the change law edict.

sentences.zh: 令民為什伍，而相牧司連坐。

translations.literal: Ordered the people to form groups of ten and five, mutually supervise and connect in joint responsibility.

sentences.zh: 不告姦者腰斬，告姦者與斬敵首同賞，匿姦者與降敵同罰。

translations.literal: Those who do not report crimes are cut in half at the waist, those who report crimes receive same reward as beheading enemies, those who conceal crimes receive same punishment as surrendering to enemies.

sentences.zh: 民有二男以上不分異者，倍其賦。

translations.literal: Families with two or more sons not dividing households double their taxes.

sentences.zh: 有軍功者，各以率受上爵；

translations.literal: Those with military merit each according to rate receive higher ranks;

sentences.zh: 為私斗者，各以輕重被刑大小。

translations.literal: Those who fight privately each according to severity receive punishments great and small.

sentences.zh: 僇力本業，耕織致粟帛多者復其身。

translations.literal: Those who exert strength in fundamental occupations, farming and weaving produce much grain and silk are exempted from labor service.

sentences.zh: 事末利及怠而貧者，舉以為收孥。

translations.literal: Those who engage in secondary pursuits and indolent poor people are enslaved.

sentences.zh: 宗室非有軍功論，不得為屬籍。

translations.literal: Royal clan without military merit discussion cannot be on the registers.

sentences.zh: 明尊卑爵秩等級，各以差次名田宅，臣妾衣服以家次。

translations.literal: Clearly establish noble and base ranks and grades, each according to status names fields and houses, ministers and concubines clothing according to family rank.

sentences.zh: 有功者顯榮，無功者雖富無所芬華。

translations.literal: Those with merit are illustrious and honored, those without merit though rich have no splendor.

Ordered the people to form groups of ten and five, mutually supervise and connect in joint responsibility. Those who do not report crimes are cut in half at the waist, those who report crimes receive same reward as beheading enemies, those who conceal crimes receive same punishment as surrendering to enemies. Families with two or more sons not dividing households double their taxes. Those with military merit each according to rate receive higher ranks; Those who fight privately each according to severity receive punishments great and small. Those who exert strength in fundamental occupations, farming and weaving produce much grain and silk are exempted from labor service. Those who engage in secondary pursuits and indolent poor people are enslaved. Royal clan without military merit discussion cannot be on the registers. Clearly establish noble and base ranks and grades, each according to status names fields and houses, ministers and concubines clothing according to family rank. Those with merit are illustrious and honored, those without merit though rich have no splendor.

sentences.zh: 令既具，未布，恐民之不信，已乃立三丈之木於國都市南門，募民有能徙置北門者予十金。

translations.literal: The edict having been prepared but not yet promulgated, fearing the people would not believe, then erected a three zhang wooden pole in the southern gate of the capital market, recruited people who could move it to the northern gate rewarded ten jin.

sentences.zh: 民怪之，莫敢徙。

translations.literal: The people thought it strange, none dared move it.

sentences.zh: 復曰「能徙者予五十金」。

translations.literal: Again said "Those who can move it receive fifty jin".

sentences.zh: 有一人徙之，輒予五十金，以明不欺。

translations.literal: One person moved it, immediately gave fifty jin, to show not deceiving.

sentences.zh: 卒下令。

translations.literal: Finally promulgated the edict.

The edict having been prepared but not yet promulgated, fearing the people would not believe, then erected a three zhang wooden pole in the southern gate of the capital market, recruited people who could move it to the northern gate rewarded ten jin. The people thought it strange, none dared move it. Again said "Those who can move it receive fifty jin". One person moved it, immediately gave fifty jin, to show not deceiving. Finally promulgated the edict.

sentences.zh: 令行於民朞年，秦民之國都言初令之不便者以千數。

translations.literal: The edict having circulated among the people for a year, Qin people in the capital who spoke of the initial edict being inconvenient numbered in the thousands.

sentences.zh: 於是太子犯法。

translations.literal: Then the crown prince violated the law.

sentences.zh: 衛鞅曰：「法之不行，自上犯之。」

translations.literal: Wei Yang said: "The law not being implemented starts from above violating it."

sentences.zh: 將法太子。

translations.literal: Would apply the law to the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子，君嗣也，不可施刑，刑其傅公子虔，黥其師公孫賈。

translations.literal: The crown prince is the ruler heir, cannot apply punishment, punished his tutor Gongzi Qian by tattoo, branded his teacher Gongsun Jia.

sentences.zh: 明日，秦人皆趨令。

translations.literal: The next day, Qin people all rushed to obey the law.

sentences.zh: 行之十年，秦民大說，道不拾遺，山無盜賊，家給人足。

translations.literal: Implemented for ten years, Qin people greatly delighted, roads had no lost items, mountains had no bandits, households sufficient people full.

sentences.zh: 民勇於公戰，怯於私斗，鄉邑大治。

translations.literal: People brave in public battles, cowardly in private fights, villages and towns greatly governed.

sentences.zh: 秦民初言令不便者有來言令便者，衛鞅曰「此皆亂化之民也」，盡遷之於邊城。

translations.literal: Qin people who initially said the edict was inconvenient came saying it was convenient, Wei Yang said "These are all people who disrupt reform", all relocated them to border cities.

sentences.zh: 其後民莫敢議令。

translations.literal: Afterward the people dared not criticize the edict.

The edict having circulated among the people for a year, Qin people in the capital who spoke of the initial edict being inconvenient numbered in the thousands. Then the crown prince violated the law. Wei Yang said: "The law not being implemented starts from above violating it." Would apply the law to the crown prince. The crown prince is the ruler heir, cannot apply punishment, punished his tutor Gongzi Qian by tattoo, branded his teacher Gongsun Jia. The next day, Qin people all rushed to obey the law. Implemented for ten years, Qin people greatly delighted, roads had no lost items, mountains had no bandits, households sufficient people full. People brave in public battles, cowardly in private fights, villages and towns greatly governed. Qin people who initially said the edict was inconvenient came saying it was convenient, Wei Yang said "These are all people who disrupt reform", all relocated them to border cities. Afterward the people dared not criticize the edict.

sentences.zh: 於是以鞅為大良造。

translations.literal: Then made Yang Grand Commandant.

sentences.zh: 將兵圍魏安邑，降之。

translations.literal: Led troops besieged Wei Anyi, took it in surrender.

sentences.zh: 居三年，作為筑冀闕宮庭於咸陽，秦自雍徙都之。

translations.literal: After three years, built and constructed the Ji Que palace courtyard in Xianyang, Qin moved the capital from Yong to it.

sentences.zh: 而令民父子兄弟同室內息者為禁。

translations.literal: And ordered that people father and sons brothers sleeping in same room be forbidden.

sentences.zh: 而集小（都）鄉邑聚為縣，置令、丞，凡三十一縣。

translations.literal: And gathered small towns and villages into counties, established magistrates and assistants, altogether thirty-one counties.

sentences.zh: 為田開阡陌封疆，而賦稅平。

translations.literal: Opened fields with paths and borders, and taxes made even.

sentences.zh: 平斗桶權衡丈尺。

translations.literal: Made bushels, pecks, balances, weights, rods, and feet uniform.

sentences.zh: 行之四年，公子虔復犯約，劓之。

translations.literal: Implemented for four years, Gongzi Qian again violated the agreement, cut off his nose.

sentences.zh: 居五年，秦人富彊，天子致胙於孝公，諸侯畢賀。

translations.literal: After five years, Qin people rich and strong, the Son of Heaven sent sacrificial meat to Duke Xiao, all feudal lords congratulated.

sentences.zh: 其明年，齊敗魏兵於馬陵，虜其太子申，殺將軍龐涓。

translations.literal: The next year, Qi defeated Wei troops at Ma Ling, captured their crown prince Shen, killed general Pang Juan.

sentences.zh: 其明年，衛鞅說孝公曰：「秦之與魏，譬若人之有腹心疾，非魏并秦，秦即并魏。

translations.literal: The next year, Wei Yang advised Duke Xiao: "Qin and Wei are like a person with abdominal heart disease, if Wei does not annex Qin, Qin will annex Wei.

sentences.zh: 何者？

translations.literal: Why?

sentences.zh: 魏居領阨之西，都安邑，與秦界河而獨擅山東之利。

translations.literal: Wei occupies the strategic pass west, capital at Anyi, borders Qin at the Yellow River and monopolizes the advantages east of the mountains.

sentences.zh: 利則西侵秦，病則東收地。

translations.literal: When advantageous then invades west into Qin, when troubled then withdraws east to collect territory.

sentences.zh: 今以君之賢聖，國賴以盛。

translations.literal: Now with Your Lordship wise and sage, the state relies on flourishing.

sentences.zh: 而魏往年大破於齊，諸侯畔之，可因此時伐魏。

translations.literal: Wei in recent years greatly defeated by Qi, feudal lords rebel against it, can take advantage of this time to attack Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏不支秦，必東徙。

translations.literal: Wei cannot withstand Qin, must move east.

sentences.zh: 東徙，秦據河山之固，東鄉以制諸侯，此帝王之業也。」

translations.literal: Moving east, Qin occupies the Yellow River mountain stronghold, facing east to control the feudal lords, this is the enterprise of emperors and kings."

sentences.zh: 孝公以為然，使衛鞅將而伐魏。

translations.literal: Duke Xiao considered it correct, sent Wei Yang to lead and attack Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏使公子卬將而擊之。

translations.literal: Wei sent Gongzi Ang to lead and attack him.

sentences.zh: 軍既相距，衛鞅遺魏將公子卬書曰：「吾始與公子驩，今俱為兩國將，不忍相攻，可與公子面相見，盟，樂飲而罷兵，以安秦魏。」

translations.literal: Armies having confronted, Wei Yang sent letter to Wei general Gongzi Ang: "I initially was friendly with Gongzi, now both serve as generals of two states, cannot bear to attack each other, can meet Gongzi face to face, form alliance, joyfully drink and cease hostilities, to pacify Qin and Wei."

sentences.zh: 魏公子卬以為然。

translations.literal: Wei Gongzi Ang considered it correct.

sentences.zh: 會盟已，飲，而衛鞅伏甲士而襲虜魏公子卬，因攻其軍，盡破之以歸秦。

translations.literal: Alliance meeting completed, drinking, Wei Yang ambushed armored soldiers and attacked captured Wei Gongzi Ang, then attacked his army, completely defeated it and returned to Qin.

sentences.zh: 魏惠王兵數破於齊秦，國內空，日以削，恐，乃使使割河西之地獻於秦以和。

translations.literal: Wei Hui Wang troops repeatedly defeated by Qi and Qin, state internally empty, daily diminishing, fearful, then sent envoy to cede west of Yellow River territory to Qin to make peace.

sentences.zh: 而魏遂去安邑，徙都大梁。

translations.literal: Wei then left Anyi, moved capital to Da Liang.

sentences.zh: 梁惠王曰：「寡人恨不用公叔座之言也。」

translations.literal: Liang Hui Wang said: "I regret not using Gongshu Zuo words."

sentences.zh: 衛鞅既破魏還，秦封之於、商十五邑，號為商君。

translations.literal: Wei Yang having defeated Wei returned, Qin enfeoffed him with Shang fifteen cities, titled Lord Shang.

sentences.zh: 商君相秦十年，宗室貴戚多怨望者。

translations.literal: Lord Shang served as Qin chancellor ten years, royal clan nobles many resentful.

sentences.zh: 趙良見商君。

translations.literal: Zhao Liang saw Lord Shang.

sentences.zh: 商君曰：「鞅之得見也，從孟蘭皋，今鞅請得交，可乎？」

translations.literal: Lord Shang said: "Yang obtained audience through Meng Lan Gao, now Yang wishes to form friendship with you, acceptable?"

sentences.zh: 趙良曰：「仆弗敢願也。

translations.literal: Zhao Liang said: "Servant does not dare desire it.

sentences.zh: 孔丘有言曰：『推賢而戴者進，聚不肖而王者退。』

translations.literal: Kong Qiu has words: Advance worthy and place them above, gather unworthy and kings retreat.

sentences.zh: 仆不肖，故不敢受命。

translations.literal: Servant unworthy, therefore dare not accept command.

sentences.zh: 仆聞之曰：『非其位而居之曰貪位，非其名而有之曰貪名。』

translations.literal: Servant heard: Not in position yet occupy it called greedy for position, not have name yet possess it called greedy for name.

sentences.zh: 仆聽君之義，則恐仆貪位貪名也。

translations.literal: Servant hears Your Lordship righteousness, then fears servant greedy for position greedy for name.

sentences.zh: 故不敢聞命。」

translations.literal: Therefore dare not hear command."

sentences.zh: 商君曰：「子不說吾治秦與？」

translations.literal: Lord Shang said: "You not pleased with my governing Qin?"

sentences.zh: 趙良曰：「反聽之謂聰，內視之謂明，自勝之謂彊。

translations.literal: Zhao Liang said: "Listen to opposition called intelligent, examine internally called clear, conquer self called strong.

sentences.zh: 虞舜有言曰：『自卑也尚矣。』

translations.literal: Yu Shun has words: From humility still excellent.

sentences.zh: 君不若道虞舜之道，無為問仆矣。」

translations.literal: Your Lordship not as good as follow Yu Shun way, no need ask servant."

sentences.zh: 商君曰：「始秦戎翟之教，父子無別，同室而居。

translations.literal: Lord Shang said: "Initially Qin Rong Di teachings, fathers and sons no distinction, same room dwelling.

sentences.zh: 今我更制其教，而為其男女之別，大筑冀闕，營如魯衛矣。

translations.literal: Now I change their teachings, establish distinction between males and females, greatly build Ji Que, flourish like Lu and Wei.

sentences.zh: 子觀我治秦也，孰與五羖大夫賢？」

translations.literal: You observe my governing Qin, who compares to Five Ram Skin Grand Master?"

sentences.zh: 趙良曰：「千羊之皮，不如一狐之掖；

translations.literal: Zhao Liang said: "Thousand sheep skins, not as one fox collar;

sentences.zh: 千人之諾諾，不如一士之諤諤。

translations.literal: Thousand people yes-yes, not as one scholar frank-frank.

sentences.zh: 武王諤諤以昌，殷紂墨墨以亡。

translations.literal: Wu Wang frank-frank to prosper, Yin Zhou flattering to perish.

sentences.zh: 君若不非武王乎，則仆請終日正言而無誅，可乎？」

translations.literal: Your Lordship if not criticize Wu Wang, then servant please all day correct words without punishment, acceptable?"

sentences.zh: 商君曰：「語有之矣，貌言華也，至言實也，苦言藥也，甘言疾也。

translations.literal: Lord Shang said: "Words have it, appearance words flowery, core words substantial, bitter words medicine, sweet words sickness.

sentences.zh: 夫子果肯終日正言，鞅之藥也。

translations.literal: Sir indeed willing all day correct words, Yang medicine.

sentences.zh: 鞅將事子，子又何辭焉！」

translations.literal: Yang will serve Sir, Sir why decline!"

sentences.zh: 趙良曰：「夫五羖大夫，荊之鄙人也。

translations.literal: Zhao Liang said: "Five Ram Skin Grand Master, Jing barbarian.

sentences.zh: 聞秦繆公之賢而願望見，行而無資，自粥於秦客，被褐食牛。

translations.literal: Heard Qin Mu Gong worthy wished see, traveled without resources, sold self to Qin guest, wore coarse ate cattle.

sentences.zh: 期年，繆公知之，舉之牛口之下，而加之百姓之上，秦國莫敢望焉。

translations.literal: One year, Mu Gong knew him, raised from cattle mouth below, placed above hundred families, Qin state none dared rival.

sentences.zh: 相秦六七年，而東伐鄭，三置晉國之君，一救荊國之禍。

translations.literal: Served as Qin chancellor six seven years, east attacked Zheng, three times established Jin state rulers, once saved Jing state calamity.

sentences.zh: 發教封內，而巴人致貢；

translations.literal: Five Ram Skin Grand Master died, Qin state males females flowed tears, children not sing songs, pestle not pound.

sentences.zh: 此五羖大夫之德也。

translations.literal: This Five Ram Skin Grand Master virtue.

sentences.zh: 今君之見秦王也，因嬖人景監以為主，非所以為名也。

translations.literal: Now Your Lordship see Qin king, through favored person Jing Jian as master, not way to make name.

translations.literal: Chancellor Qin not take hundred families as affairs, greatly build Ji Que, not way to make merit.

sentences.zh: 今君又左建外易，非所以為教也。

translations.literal: Now Your Lordship again left establish external change, not way to teach.

sentences.zh: 君又南面而稱寡人，日繩秦之貴公子。

translations.literal: Your Lordship again face south call solitary person, daily restrain Qin noble sons.

translations.literal: Poetry says: Rat has body, person without ritual, person without ritual, why not quickly die.

sentences.zh: 以詩觀之，非所以為壽也。

translations.literal: Observe with poetry, not way for longevity.

sentences.zh: 公子虔杜門不出已八年矣，君又殺祝懽而黥公孫賈。

translations.literal: Gongzi Qian closed door not go out already eight years, Your Lordship again kill Zhu Huan tattoo Gongsun Jia.

sentences.zh: 《詩》曰：『得人者興，失人者崩。』

translations.literal: Poetry says: Obtain people prosper, lose people collapse.

sentences.zh: 此數事者，非所以得人也。

translations.literal: These several matters are not the ways to obtain people.

sentences.zh: 君之出也，後車十數，從車載甲，多力而駢脅者為驂乘，持矛而操闟戟者旁車而趨。

translations.literal: Your Lordship go out, following carriages ten several, retinue carriages carry armor, strong muscular paired ribs as chariot drivers, hold spears grasp halberds beside carriages hasten.

sentences.zh: 此一物不具，君固不出。

translations.literal: This one thing not prepared, Your Lordship certainly not go out.

sentences.zh: 《書》曰：『恃德者昌，恃力者亡。』

translations.literal: Documents say: Rely on virtue prosper, rely on force perish.

sentences.zh: 君之危若朝露，尚將欲延年益壽乎？

translations.literal: Your Lordship danger like morning dew, still wish prolong years increase life?

sentences.zh: 則何不歸十五都，灌園於鄙，勸秦王顯巖穴之士，養老存孤，敬父兄，序有功，尊有德，可以少安。

translations.literal: Then why not return the fifteen cities, tend gardens in the countryside, urge the Qin king to promote scholars living in mountain caves, care for the elderly and orphans, respect fathers and elder brothers, reward the meritorious, and honor the virtuous? This would bring some measure of security.

sentences.zh: 君尚將貪商於之富，寵秦國之教，畜百姓之怨，秦王一旦捐賓客而不立朝，秦國之所以收君者，豈其微哉？

translations.literal: Your Lordship still greedy Shang richness, favor Qin state teachings, accumulate hundred families resentment, Qin king one day cast aside guests not establish court, Qin state means to collect Your Lordship, how slight!

translations.literal: After five months Qin Duke Xiao died, crown prince established.

sentences.zh: 公子虔之徒告商君欲反，發吏捕商君。

translations.literal: Gongzi Qian followers informed Lord Shang wished rebel, sent officials capture Lord Shang.

sentences.zh: 商君亡至關下，欲舍客舍。

translations.literal: Lord Shang fled to border pass, wished lodge in inn.

sentences.zh: 客人不知其是商君也，曰：「商君之法，舍人無驗者坐之。」

translations.literal: Innkeeper not know he was Lord Shang, said: "Lord Shang law, lodge people without verification punish them."

sentences.zh: 商君喟然嘆曰：「嗟乎，為法之敝一至此哉！」

translations.literal: Lord Shang sighed: "Alas, law defects to this extent!"

sentences.zh: 去之魏。

translations.literal: Departed to Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏人怨其欺公子卬而破魏師，弗受。

translations.literal: Wei people resented his deceiving Gongzi Ang breaking Wei army, not accept.

sentences.zh: 商君欲之他國。

sentences.zh: 魏人曰：「商君，秦之賊。

translations.literal: Wei people said: "Lord Shang, Qin traitor.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Wei said, "Lord Shang is Qin's traitor.

sentences.zh: 秦彊而賊入魏，弗歸，不可。」

translations.literal: Qin strong traitor enter Wei, not return, unacceptable."

sentences.zh: 遂內秦。

translations.literal: Then sent back to Qin.

sentences.zh: 商君既復入秦，走商邑，與其徒屬發邑兵北出擊鄭。

translations.literal: Lord Shang having returned to Qin, fled Shang city, with his followers raised city troops north out attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 秦發兵攻商君，殺之於鄭黽池。

translations.literal: Qin sent troops attacked Lord Shang, killed him at Zheng Meng Pool.

sentences.zh: 秦惠王車裂商君以徇，曰：「莫如商鞅反者！」

translations.literal: Then extinguished Lord Shang family.

sentences.zh: 跡其欲干孝公以帝王術，挾持浮說，非其質矣。

translations.literal: Trace his desire approach Duke Xiao with emperor king arts, grasped floating arguments, not his substance.

sentences.zh: 且所因由嬖臣，及得用，刑公子虔，欺魏將卬，不師趙良之言，亦足發明商君之少恩矣。

translations.literal: Moreover what relied on favored minister, obtained use, punished Gongzi Qian, deceived Wei general Ang, not follow Zhao Liang words, also sufficient to reveal Lord Shang little kindness.

sentences.zh: 余嘗讀商君開塞耕戰書，與其人行事相類。

translations.literal: I once read Lord Shang opening closing farming war book, with his person conduct similar.

sentences.zh: 卒受惡名於秦，有以也夫！

translations.literal: Finally received evil name in Qin, reason!
